ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I continued to build upon the skills I learned in JAPN 110, learning a few dozen more kanji, grammar structures, vocabulary, etc.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Very helpful for student learning. I wish the assignment were more evenly spaced out. Sometimes we would have 3-4 assignments due in a day.

Strengths: The pacing of the class is fast but not overwhelming.
Weaknesses: Quite a bit of homework, and meets on Friday (although this is to be expected for a language class); we also spent a lot of time in-class writing, which feels a bit weird, since I feel like the little time we have in-person should be spent conversing and practicing speaking face-to-face.

I want to express some concerns I have regarding the course. I find the workload to be quite overwhelming and feel that it may be too much for the allotted time. Additionally, I find the rubrics for assignments to be unclear, which makes it difficult for me to meet the expectations.

Furthermore, I have noticed that during the lectures, there is an excessive amount of irrelevant information being presented, and some of the content feels repetitive. This can be confusing and hinders my ability to fully grasp the key concepts of the course.

I understand that teaching a course can be challenging, and I appreciate your effort and dedication. However, I wanted to bring these concerns to your attention in the hope that they can be addressed to enhance the learning experience for all students.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments:
While I believe the course itself is valuable and beneficial, I have some concerns about the current instructor's teaching style and approach.

Considering my experience as a student in this course, I would like to recommend exploring the possibility of taking a different instructor for the Japanese course.
